text: Acestrorhynchus falcirostris is a species of fish in the family Acestrorhynchidae. It was described by Georges Cuvier in 1819, originally under the genus Hydrocyon. It inhabits the Orinoco and Amazon Rivers in the area of Guyana, at a pH range of 5.2-7.2, and a dH range of 5-18. It reaches a maximum standard length of . The diet of A. falcirostris includes finfish, shrimp and insects.Food items reported for Acestrorhynchus falcirostris at www.fishbase.org. It is harvested by commercial fisheries, and is also sold to public aquariums. ==References== Category:Acestrorhynchidae Category:Fish described in 1819
title: Acestrorhynchus falcirostris
